newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia minister to probe Saudi prostitution.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia minister to probe Saudi prostitution.

text.p: Indonesian Minister for Women's Affairs Mien Sugandhi will visit Saudi Arabia to investigate the plight of Indonesian women working there as prostitutes, the official Antara news agency reported on Thursday.
"The amount is not in the tens, but already in the hundreds," she told reporters after meeting President Suharto. The report gave no further details about the proposed visit.
Sugandhi said the women, usually below 20 years old and from poor villages, were usually recruited and sent overseas as workers.
The report said Sugandhi reported to Suharto about her planned visit to Malaysia to investigate the plight of around 185,000 Indonesian women working there.
It said she will be accompanied by members of parliament as well as officials from the foreign and manpower ministries. It gave no further details.
